dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news coming out of, uh, Visa's operations in Central Asia. We have a new Country Manager.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That makes a lot of sense for Visa, especially with their push for, um, digital payments in that region. What are his main objectives?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, his key tasks are to stimulate business growth, strengthen cooperation with partner banks and government agencies, and, uh, develop new partnerships. It's a pretty big plate.

dialogue_turns.text: And I saw a quote from him, he sounded really excited. He mentioned the payment sector developing at a tremendous pace in Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. He's quite optimistic about his experience benefiting the company and the region. And, um, speaking of previous roles, Rafal Trepka, the former Country Manager, he's actually moving on.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're even assisting the National Bank and government of Kazakhstan in expanding the payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through their network.

dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. With Sanzhar's background, like, an Executive MBA from Cambridge and a CFA, they've clearly got, um, top talent leading the charge.
